title: 106_hr1860
content: The text chunk "SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE; FINDINGS." summarizes the title and key findings of a section. The Act titled "Medically Underserved Access to Care Act of 1999" acknowledges that minority individuals in underserved areas face socioeconomic challenges and often receive lower quality healthcare from managed care organizations. Concerns exist about selective marketing practices and referral processes affecting minority physicians. Selective marketing practices and referral processes may exclude minority and community-based physicians from some managed care organizations, especially those who are not board certified despite being well-established in underserved areas. SEC. 2. REQUIREMENT FOR SERVICE TO AREAS THAT INCLUDE A MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED POPULATION. A managed care organization offering a managed care plan must establish adequate arrangements with a sufficient number of healthcare professionals and providers to ensure covered items and services are available and accessible to enrollees in various locations, with reasonable promptness and proximity to their residences and workplaces, taking into account diverse needs. The managed care organization must ensure continuity of care and meet the needs of enrollees by having arrangements with healthcare professionals in underserved areas to comply with the requirements of the Public Health Service Act. For purposes of applying various federal laws, the requirements of subsection (a) shall be treated as though they were included in specific parts of those laws. For purposes of applying federal laws, subsection (a) requirements are treated as part of specific sections. Additionally, the Secretary must ensure Medicare+Choice organizations comply with these requirements, and no funds will be paid to states for Medicaid services unless the requirements are met. The Secretary must ensure compliance with subsection (a) requirements by Medicaid managed care organizations to receive payment for medical assistance. Establishment of Grant Program: The Secretary will create a grant program in the Office of Minority Health to award competitive grants to nongovernmental agencies. These grants will help develop outreach programs to inform individuals in medically underserved areas on accessing managed care organizations and assist healthcare professionals in enrolling as providers. Eligibility criteria and grant amounts will be determined by the Secretary. For purposes of this Act, an enrollee is an individual enrolled in a managed care plan offered by a managed care organization. A health care professional is a licensed physician or practitioner providing health care services. A health plan refers to group health plans or health insurance coverage offered by a health insurance issuer. A managed care organization includes entities like health maintenance organizations or provider-sponsored organizations offering managed care services. A managed care plan is a health plan offered by an entity that provides health care items and services to enrollees through participating health care professionals and providers, or offers financial incentives to encourage enrollees to use participating providers. A medically underserved area is designated as a health professional shortage area or a medically underserved area for certain purposes. Participating refers to health care professionals or providers who furnish services under an agreement with an entity. A primary care provider acts as a gatekeeper for the overall care of an enrollee. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Health and Human Services.
